dijkstras.info: Dijkstra's algorithm is widely employed for solving single-source shortest path problems with non-negative edge weights in graphs, aiming to determine the shortest distance between two vertices.

dfs.info: Depth first Search or Depth first traversal is a recursive algorithm for searching all the vertices of a graph or tree data structure. Traversal means visiting all the nodes of a graph.

astar.info: The A* Search Algorithm is motivated by the need to efficiently approximate the shortest path in real-life situations, such as maps or games with obstacles. It is a smart path-finding technique widely used due to its effectiveness in navigating through obstacles.
